https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/57831/ : FAILURE
Fix all the shell check warning's related to new changes.
Done
change to opdreport ?
Done
Please add why  this new scrip?
Done
typo
Done
is this internal tool?
Yes. Removing
Done

Question is , this tool is specific to hostboot dump ?
Commitr message updated for general purpose. here description is based on hostbootdump
Add cooment, in the code.
be consistent then , seeing some places using log_error .
be consistent then , seeing some places using log_error .

Be clear in the commit message on the scope. also consistent in the coding.
Based on the commit message we already have use for this . i think better contryl this using varibkle will help to extend support in future easilyu.

be careful, do we have any code in application side to celanup this? otherwise this can cause filsystem issue with available size. 
or are you considering this here , during allowed checking szie?
This tool is only used for hostbootdump. There are other hostdumps , like SBE, Hw dump etc also required similiar packaging.
Yes, as per discussion looks like we will keep it similar to FSP i.e. gz
Done

-s, --size <size>     Maximum allowed size(in KB) of the archive.
                            Report will be truncated in case size exceeds
                               this limit. Default size is unlimited.
How you are you making sure the sump packaging is with in the allowed size?
application is doing size checking.

These some of the good to have option for debugging , are you planing to enable separate commit for supporting this?  
       -v, —-verbose         Increase logging verbosity.
         -V, --version         Output version information.
         -q, —-quiet           Only log fatal errors to stderr
Yes will be adding these in separate commit.
Done
Not seeing any place these variables used.
Changed. Done.
Done
Hbdump indicates hostboot dump or hostdump? is this script default behaviour is hostboot dump type?
throw error?
hostboot dump. Yes keeping hbdump as default.
Done
not seeing any exit here, either stop the packaging or got with default behaviour, like keeping in /tmp path.
OK. If fails dump_dir="/tmp"
Done
remove
Done

should be an error message? what is the user expectes here ? there should eb some indication of of either missing info here. 
General command:
dreport uses echo message to avoind summary log file. Here not using summary log right? better be consistent , like either use log-xx or echo.
We don't have summary log file here. Keeping echo.
Done
Is this true for all type of dumps?
for hostboot and hw.. not SBE
Not sure if it's common for other dumps. As on we add support for other dumps this might change based on dump type.
Done
Make sure add gzip dependncy in dump packaging.
Done
This should be checking prior to 102?
Done
rm -rf $optional_path removal is not required here?
Nope. As the operation failed and we dont want to lose the optional path. Deleting it only when we successfully create the tar and move it to the requested path.
Done
need to add -t, -q, and -v options too, you may make it no-op now if that is not being implemented in this commit.
enable this in new commit is also fine.
but if we just support that now, there wont be changes in c++ code,

Done. Made it same as dreport args.
Changed from hostboot dumps to host dumps.
It will be good keep this information in common place like , <dreport source>/xx. similiar path is used in dreport also.
Done. Adding a new file dcommon which will be placed in dreport/

same used in dreport. better to move common include file.
This commit define new include file and keep the common defeinition in dreport/opdrepor definitions. and you can push new commit to update dreport to consume the common file.
Done
Removed log_error. Using echo
Done
where is the allowed dump size comparoison?
Done
This is also potential function to move in common place.
Done
I think you can keep type as system dump or hostdump since there is no special handling for hostboot dump
Done
no default, this should be error
Done
Done
There is no special handling for hostboot dump, the header should be common for all system dumps, so this should be hostdump or systemdump
Done
this should be hostdump or system dump
Done
If name is not given assume SYSDUMP
Done
If destination is not given package to CWD
Will do this in a new commit.
can u respond to the unresloved comments?
Why this tool is not keeping in phosphor-debug-collector/tools/dreport.d/openpower.d path? This is more like IBM specific dump packaging tool.
This this related to openpower dump. That's why we decided to keep it in dump-extension path.
openpower.d  path is intended to keep all the openpower specific tools. Any limitation in keepthis here?
Done.
Is this optional or required input?
optional.
Better to update docuemntation saying optional parameter.
Rephrasing to "Name to be used for the archive. Default name format                        SYSDUMP.<serial number>.<dump_id>.<time>. Optional parameter."
Is the required or optional input?
optional. If input is not provided will place in current working directory.
Better to update docuemntation saying optional parameter.
Same as name param will add in the end i.e. optional param.
Is this required or optional ?
required.
Documentation say's "Optional contents " . updated required.
Updated to "Contents to be included in the archive"
Not used
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/42746/comments/e4a2bde2_dab42303
Only enable the implemented option, am not seeing any valid reason to add options, which is not enabled here.
Done.
Unused Variable?
used in header script.
Be consistent then. using diffrent varibale name is in header and this script. TYPE_OPDUMP="opdump" vs OP_DUMP="opdump"
Unused Variable?

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/42746/comments/e4a2bde2_dab42303

Anyways removed.

Fix Build warning
In dump-extensions/openpower-dumps/opdreport line 66:
declare -x dDay=$(date -d @$EPOCHTIME +'%Y%m%d%H%M%S')
           ^--^ SC2155 (warning): Declare and assign separately to avoid masking return values.
                           ^--------^ SC2086 (info): Double quote to prevent globbing and word splitting.
Done
Unused Variable?
Done
why dump_dir is not keeping in /tmp?
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/42746/comments/59142992_d83a99b1

Since this is temporary file , better to keep in /tmp path as default . this will help to avoid cleaning up of file automatically after the consumption. Incase user got specific reason for keeping cutom path they should use the optional parameter.
Done.
elog_id=$(basename "$optional_path") logic is not going to extract required info here?
Nope. We need Errorlog file path. There can be a possibility that its not even there.
Error log is not mandatory for  system dump? incase failed to pass optional parameter should we go with some default ID?
Done
Here you are assuming plat_dump/*Sbe* is going to be part of current dir. it will be good to use full path optional files instead of assuming you are in actual path.

Can you add some comments here dump data is stored in plat_dump? 
Plat_dump is going to have only the data assicated to this dump request , wondering any dump ID based data storage implmented in application code?

added comment
It will contain data related to platform dump. Nope no dump id related dump will be stored, which ever data is present in platdump will be in *Sbe* format. We will pick it and zip the same.
Nope, no assumption made. Script will "cd" to that path and look for the files.

Build warning:

In dump-extensions/openpower-dumps/opdreport line 157:
    cat "$name" | tee -a "/tmp/dumpheader_$EPOCHTIME" > /dev/null
        ^-----^ SC2002 (style): Useless cat. Consider 'cmd < file | ..' or 'cmd file | ..' instead.
We are trying to append the data i.e. tar files to header.
Any specific reason for keeping plat_dump/*Sbe* after packaging , should be removed?
Getting removed in line 169.
This is not matching with help description.
Done
Not used?
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-debug-collector/+/42746/comments/e4a2bde2_dab42303
Remove unused options
Done.
what happens if elog_id="", i.e if it failed to find it in opdreport script?

if that happens, x will be 0.
msize will be 4 and we will end up adding 4 bytes with 0's
Commit message say's only hostbootdump enabled. Looking at the comment here it say's Harwdare dump section. am missing something here?

http://fstone07p1.aus.stglabs.ibm.com:8080/source/xref/fips1010/src/dump/fsp/dumpSummary.H?r=892f485d#145

This is section name, like we have File section, hardware dump section etc.
